AHK.caption: Use table custom margins?
AHK.doc: Below you will be able to set extra margins for your table element. Leave this field as "no" for a default display (will ignore any margin-related numbers below).
AHK.name: table_custom_margins

AHP.caption: Table layout
AHP.doc: Choose a style and see if it pleases you!
AHP.name: table_layout
AHP.options: Standard,No Borders,Header Line Only,Light Horizontal Lines,Strong Outer Border,Zebra,Light Horizontal Lines Without Header

AHQ.caption: Table name
AHQ.doc: Name of the table that will be concluded.
AHQ.name: table_name

AHR.caption: Page break
AHR.doc: Choose if this element will enforce a new page before or after itself.
AHR.name: page_break

AHS.caption: Into multi column
AHS.doc: Use "yes" to insert this table into a multi column.
AHS.name: into_multi_column

AHT.caption: This multicolumn width
AHT.doc: Fit content will make the column have the width of their content. Fit available space will extend the column's width to all horizontal avaliable space in the page.
AHT.name: this_column_width

AHU.caption: Into footer
AHU.doc: Use "yes" if this element is to be inserted into the footer.
AHU.name: into_footer

AHV.caption: Into header
AHV.doc: Use "yes" if this element is to be inserted into the header.
AHV.name: into_header

AHW.caption: Into background
AHW.doc: Use "yes" if this element is to be inserted into the background.
AHW.name: into_background

AHX.caption: Multi column name
AHX.doc: The name of the multi column you're wrapping this element within.
AHX.name: multi_column_name

AOz.caption: Fixed width size
AOz.doc: If you select "Fixed width" in the dropdown above then you must specify a number here. Play with numbers to check the size, but know that the size here is in "points" not "pixels". You can search the web to know more about that unit of measure.
AOz.name: fixed_width_column_size
